task.title: Procedure: Performing a VNF or VDU group backup with CBAM

context.sectiondiv:
An operator can use this procedure to backup an entire VNF at any time using the CBAM GUI.
This procedure can also be used to backup the data for one vdu group (for example, in the vdu-OAME group there are two nodes: oame 0 and oame 1). If the backup_mode is “NONE”, each vdu group’s backup data is backed up to the “/BACKUP” directory on the active OAME node, or it is backed up to the NFS server, after a successful backup. The backup log for each node is available on the active OAME at “/var/log/BR/BR.log”.
Before you begin:CBAM must exist as the VNFM for the Backup and Restore.
The NCC instantiate must have been successful with the backup_mode="NETBKUP" or backup_mode="NONE" in this procedure.
The configuration for the backup server must be complete.
Ensure that the MariaDB and Maxscale are UP and running using the “Checking mariaDB and MaxScale” procedure in this guide:

step.cmd: Log in to the CBAM GUI.
Navigate to the CBAM catalogue and select the VNF from the list (the number value under the VNFs label). The VNF-specific window appears.
In the VNF-specific window, click the More button at the end of the line item and select Backup from the menu.
In the Backup window, there is the parameter: “nodes_info”. The format for the “Nodes_info” parameter is “node_group, ALL”. You can enter any of the following in the parameter field:

li.p: ALL or (“), the default value 'ALL' nodes
a combination of node_groups, for example: vdu-COMSVC, vdu-IOHO

info.p: If this is to be a backup made at upgrade time, you need to configure the su_backup parameter. By default this parameter is “no”. If this backup is executed at upgrade time, the parameter must be configured to “yes”.

step.cmd: On CBAM check the “/var/log/cbam/workflows.log” and on the active OAME node check both the “/appdata/LCM/BR/BR_deploy.log” and the “/var/log/BR/BR.log” to check the backup result and records. The backup files are also saved under the same directory in the active OAME node.

info.p: If the backup_mode is “NONE”, each node’s backup data is backed up to the “/BACKUP” directory on the active OAME node after a successful backup. The backup log for each node is available on the active OAME at “/var/log/BR/BR.log”.
If the partition type is set to "NFS", all the backup data will be backed up to the dedicated repository of the NFS server.
If the backup_mode is NETBK and the backup is successful, the data are backed up on the NETBACKUP server and you will see the result from the “Active Monitor”.
